definition: logical/only to be expected/rational and clearly structured (of text)
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
surname Cheng
chapter/section/clause/movement (of symphony)/seal/badge/regulation/order
surname Zhang

sentences.english: Nani's passage to the World Cup with Portugal was plain sailing by comparison with Evra's exertions.
sentences.chinese: 纳尼进入世界杯比起埃弗拉来讲就顺理成章的多。

sentences.english: Therefore, the Zhouyi's way of thinking has naturally become the basis for Chinese medicine.
sentences.chinese: 《周易》的思维模式也顺理成章地成为中医学的基础。

sentences.english: Mr. Chan's experience makes him a natural candidate to succeed Mr. Yam.
sentences.chinese: 陈德霖的经验使他成为任志刚顺理成章的接班候选人。

sentences.english: By applying rationalism to experience, humans can make logical leaps.
sentences.chinese: 将理论应用于实践，人类就能顺理成章地进行飞跃。

sentences.english: A matter of course, two young and lonely hearts together.
sentences.chinese: 顺理成章地，两颗年轻又孤寂的心走到了一起。

sentences.english: It would follow,then,that souls can't split.
sentences.chinese: 顺理成章，灵魂无法被分裂。

sentences.english: It stands to reason that you take the Bus in this heavy rain.
sentences.chinese: 在豪雨天里你搭公车是顺理成章的事。

definition: lit. where water flows, a canal is formed (idiom)/fig. when conditions are right, success will follow naturally
involuntary/automatically
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
in a way that justifies the use of the term/genuine/proper/in a way that conforms to logic/justifiable/appropriate/perfectly legitimate
reasonable and fair (idiom)
not at all surprising (idiom)
lit. to push the boat with the current/fig. to take advantage of the situation for one's own benefit
that clinches it/that's final/no two ways about it
easy/with no difficulty
to have one's wish fulfilled
therefore
to come as no surprise/as expected
to settle a matter by leaving it unsettled/to end up with nothing definite
to look favorably on sth/would be glad see it happen
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
not at all surprising (idiom)
